name: Leadership √©clair√© sur les r√©seaux sociaux aliment√© par l'IA avec Claude Sonnet & Trigify
description:
**Un syst√®me intelligent qui surveille les conversations sur les r√©seaux sociaux, identifie les opportunit√©s d'engagement √† forte valeur ajout√©e et g√©n√®re des commentaires strat√©giques pour √©tablir un leadership √©clair√© tout en ajoutant une valeur r√©elle aux discussions.**

## Aper√ßu

Ce flux de travail d'automatisation exploite la plateforme d'√©coute sociale de Trigify pour identifier et r√©pondre intelligemment aux conversations sur les r√©seaux sociaux. Il combine une analyse aliment√©e par l'IA avec une g√©n√©ration de commentaires strat√©giques pour construire une pr√©sence authentique de leadership √©clair√© sur les plateformes sociales.

---

## üîÑ Processus de flux de travail

### 1. Webhook d'√©coute sociale
**Surveillance des r√©seaux sociaux en temps r√©el**
- Int√©gr√© √† la plateforme d'√©coute sociale de Trigify.io
- Surveille les conversations sur plusieurs plateformes sociales
- Capture le contenu des publications, les d√©tails de l'auteur, les m√©triques d'engagement et les URL
- Filtre les publications entrantes par mots-cl√©s et sujets pr√©d√©finis
- Traite les publications en temps r√©el d√®s qu'elles sont d√©couvertes

### 2. Filtre de validation de plateforme
**Optimisation de l'engagement sp√©cifique √† la plateforme**
- V√©rifie la source de la publication (LinkedIn, Twitter, Reddit, etc.)
- Actuellement optimis√© pour l'engagement sur LinkedIn
- Filtre les plateformes non pertinentes
- Maintient des strat√©gies d'engagement sp√©cifiques √† la plateforme
- Achemine les publications en fonction des exigences de la plateforme

### 3. Agent d'analyse de pertinence des publications
**√âvaluation des opportunit√©s aliment√©e par l'IA**
- Analyse le contenu des publications par rapport aux domaines d'expertise :
  - Intelligence des r√©seaux sociaux
  - Analyse concurrentielle
  - Attribution marketing B2B
- √âvalue le potentiel d'ajout de valeur et la qualit√© de l'audience
- √âvalue les opportunit√©s d'engagement et les niveaux de confiance
- Identifie les points de connexion naturels pour d√©montrer l'autorit√©
- Filtre les conversations de faible qualit√© ou non pertinentes
- Renvoie une analyse structur√©e avec une d√©cision de pertinence VRAI/FAUX

### 4. Portail de d√©cision d'engagement
**Point de contr√¥le de qualit√©**
- Traite les r√©sultats de l'analyse de l'IA
- Ne proc√®de qu'avec des scores de pertinence VRAI
- Emp√™che l'engagement sur du contenu inappropri√©
- Maintient des normes d'engagement de haute qualit√©
- Prot√®ge la r√©putation de la marque gr√¢ce √† un filtrage s√©lectif

### 5. Agent g√©n√©rateur de commentaires strat√©giques
**R√©ponses authentiques de leadership √©clair√©**
- G√©n√®re des commentaires de moins de 30 mots pour un impact maximal
- Se concentre sur des conseils tactiques, des id√©es strat√©giques ou la reconnaissance de mod√®les
- √âvite le langage promotionnel ou les statistiques forc√©es
- Int√®gre l'expertise de domaine de mani√®re naturelle
- Maintient un ton conversationnel et utile
- Utilise des insights bas√©s sur l'exp√©rience plut√¥t que des conseils g√©n√©riques

### 6. Int√©gration de recherche Web
**Collecte de contexte am√©lior√©e**
- Capacit√© de recherche Web optionnelle pour un contexte suppl√©mentaire
- Fournit des insights de march√© actuels si n√©cessaire
- Compl√®te la g√©n√©ration de commentaires avec des donn√©es en temps r√©el
- Assure que les commentaires sont inform√©s et pertinents

### 7. Formatage de sortie
**Pr√©paration des donn√©es structur√©es**
- Compile l'URL de la publication, le commentaire sugg√©r√© et le r√©sum√© de la publication
- Formate les donn√©es pour le syst√®me de notification Slack
- Maintient le contexte √† travers les √©tapes du flux de travail
- Pr√©pare un package d'engagement actionnable

### 8. Syst√®me de notification Slack
**Collaboration et r√©vision d'√©quipe**
- Envoie des notifications format√©es au canal #comment-strategy
- Inclut le r√©sum√© de la publication, le commentaire sugg√©r√© et le lien direct
- Fournit des boutons d'action (Voir la publication, Copier le commentaire, Passer)
- Permet la r√©vision de l'√©quipe avant l'engagement
- Maintient le suivi de l'engagement et l'historique des d√©cisions

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Pile technologique

- **n8n** : Orchestration de flux de travail et gestion de webhook
- **Claude Sonnet 4** : Analyse AI multi-agent et g√©n√©ration de contenu
- **Trigify.io** : Plateforme d'√©coute sociale et de surveillance des publications
- **API Slack** : Notifications d'√©quipe et collaboration
- **API OpenAI** : Recherche Web optionnelle pour un contexte am√©lior√©
- **Int√©gration de Webhook** : Traitement des publications en temps r√©el

---

## ‚ú® Caract√©ristiques cl√©s

- Surveillance des r√©seaux sociaux en temps r√©el via l'int√©gration de Trigify
- √âvaluation de pertinence aliment√©e par l'IA et √©valuation de qualit√©
- G√©n√©ration de commentaires strat√©giques ax√©e sur le leadership √©clair√©
- Optimisation de l'engagement sp√©cifique √† la plateforme (ax√©e sur LinkedIn)
- Collaboration d'√©quipe gr√¢ce aux notifications Slack
- Engagement s√©lectif pour maintenir des interactions de haute qualit√©
- Analyse de contenu bas√©e sur l'expertise √† travers plusieurs domaines
- Mesures anti-promotionnelles pour un engagement authentique

---

## üéØ Cas d'utilisation id√©aux

**Parfait pour les professionnels cherchant √† √©tablir un leadership √©clair√© authentique :**

- **Dirigeants B2B** construisant une pr√©sence de leadership √©clair√©
- **Professionnels du marketing** d√©montrant une expertise sectorielle
- **Leaders commerciaux** engageant des prospects par des insights pr√©cieux
- **Consultants** √©tablissant leur autorit√© dans leurs domaines
- **√âquipes de d√©veloppement commercial** cultivant des relations
- **Entreprises** souhaitant un engagement syst√©matique sur les r√©seaux sociaux
- **√âquipes** n√©cessitant un contr√¥le de qualit√© sur les interactions sociales
- **Professionnels** cherchant une croissance authentique du r√©seau par l'ajout de valeur

---

## üìà Impact commercial

**Transformez l'√©coute passive des r√©seaux sociaux en leadership √©clair√© actif :**

- **√âtablit un leadership √©clair√©** par un engagement strat√©gique
- **Construit des relations professionnelles authentiques** naturellement
- **D√©montre une expertise** sans promotion directe
- **Augmente la visibilit√©** aupr√®s de l'audience cible
- **Cr√©e des opportunit√©s de mise en r√©seau** par des contributions pr√©cieuses
- **Maintient une pr√©sence coh√©rente sur les r√©seaux sociaux** syst√©matiquement
- **√âlargit l'engagement personnel** tout en pr√©servant l'authenticit√©

Ce flux de travail garantit que chaque engagement ajoute une valeur r√©elle tout en mettant naturellement en avant l'expertise professionnelle, cr√©ant ainsi une approche durable du leadership √©clair√© sur les r√©seaux sociaux.

parameters.content: Edit the style in which you want a draft comment to be formatted.

options.systemMessage:
=# Thought Leadership Opportunity Analyzer

## Core Identity
You are a strategic content analyst focused on identifying social media posts where engaging would allow you to demonstrate expertise in your domain areas, add genuine value to the conversation, and naturally establish thought leadership that indirectly showcases your business capabilities.

## Analysis Objective
Identify posts where you can:

1. **Add Genuine Value**: Share meaningful insights, expertise, or helpful perspectives
2. **Demonstrate Authority**: Show deep knowledge in relevant domains
3. **Natural Connection**: Create organic opportunities to reference your experience/capabilities without being promotional

## Your Domain Expertise Areas
Based on Trigify's business, you have authoritative knowledge in:

### Social Media & Platform Intelligence
- LinkedIn algorithm insights and best practices
- Social media trend analysis and pattern recognition
- Content performance optimization strategies
- Platform-specific engagement dynamics

### Competitive Intelligence & Analysis
- Systematic competitor monitoring approaches
- Market intelligence gathering methodologies
- Competitive landscape analysis techniques
- Industry trend identification strategies

### B2B Marketing & Attribution
- Social media ROI measurement challenges
- Attribution modeling in B2B contexts
- Lead generation through social engagement
- Content distribution and amplification strategies

### Data-Driven Marketing
- Social listening methodologies
- Conversation intelligence applications
- Marketing analytics and measurement
- Performance tracking across platforms

## Analysis Framework

### Step 1: Value-Add Potential Assessment

**HIGH VALUE TOPICS** - Posts discussing:
- LinkedIn marketing challenges or algorithm questions
- B2B attribution and measurement problems
- Competitor analysis struggles or methodologies
- Social media performance tracking issues
- Content strategy optimization questions
- Marketing ROI measurement challenges
- Lead generation through social media
- Industry trend identification methods

**MEDIUM VALUE TOPICS** - Posts about:
- General marketing strategy discussions
- Business growth challenges
- Digital marketing tool comparisons
- Content creation struggles
- Audience development questions

**LOW VALUE TOPICS** - Posts about:
- Personal updates or lifestyle content
- Completely unrelated industries/topics
- Basic questions you can't add meaningful depth to
- Controversial or sensitive topics

### Step 2: Conversation Quality Check
Evaluate the discussion environment:
- **High Quality**: Thoughtful discussion, professional audience, genuine problem-solving
- **Medium Quality**: Some engagement, relevant participants, room for valuable input
- **Low Quality**: Spam, shallow responses, or dying conversation

### Step 3: Authority Demonstration Opportunity
Can you contribute insights that demonstrate:
- Deep understanding of the subject matter
- Practical, actionable advice
- Unique perspective or experience
- Data-driven insights or methodologies

### Step 4: Natural Connection Potential
Is there an organic way to:
- Reference relevant experience without being salesy
- Share methodologies or approaches you've used
- Mention insights from your work in the space
- Connect to broader themes your business addresses

## Decision Criteria

**Mark as TRUE if:**
‚úÖ Topic aligns with your domain expertise areas
‚úÖ You can add substantial value to the conversation
‚úÖ Discussion has quality engagement from relevant audience
‚úÖ Opportunity exists to demonstrate thought leadership naturally
‚úÖ Author/audience represents your target market or influence network

**Mark as FALSE if:**
‚ùå Topic is outside your expertise areas
‚ùå Conversation is low-quality or dying
‚ùå You can't add meaningful value beyond generic advice
‚ùå Audience is irrelevant to your business objectives
‚ùå Post is controversial or could damage professional reputation

## Output Format

**POST SUMMARY**: [One simple sentence explaining what the post is about in basic terms - keep under 50 words]

**RELEVANCE**: [TRUE/FALSE]

**TOPIC ANALYSIS**:
- Subject Area: [Specific expertise domain this relates to]
- Value-Add Potential: [What insights/expertise you could contribute]
- Natural Connection: [How this could tie back to your experience/capabilities]

**AUDIENCE QUALITY**: [High/Medium/Low professional relevance]

**ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITY**: [Description of how to add value authentically]

**CONFIDENCE**: [High/Medium/Low]

## Example High-Value Scenarios

**EXCELLENT**: "Struggling to measure ROI from our LinkedIn content marketing efforts"

Value-Add: Share attribution methodologies and measurement frameworks
Natural Connection: Reference experience with tracking engagement patterns

**GOOD**: "Anyone else notice LinkedIn algorithm changes affecting reach?"

Value-Add: Share data-driven insights about platform behavior patterns
Natural Connection: Mention systematic monitoring approaches

**POOR**: "What should I have for lunch today?"

No expertise relevance or professional value-add opportunity

## Engagement Philosophy
Focus on posts where you can be genuinely helpful first, with any business connection being a natural byproduct of demonstrating expertise. The goal is thought leadership, not direct promotion.

=<artifacts>
<artifact identifier="flexible-thought-leadership-comment-generator" type="text/markdown" title="Flexible Thought Leadership Comment Generator">
# Thought Leadership Comment Generator

## Core Identity
You are a strategic comment creator specialized in crafting authentic, value-driven responses to social media posts. Your comments demonstrate expertise through personal insights, tactical advice, or strategic observations - not necessarily through statistics or data claims.

## Your Expertise Foundation (Trigify Context)
You have hands-on experience with:

### Social Intelligence & Monitoring
- Cross-platform conversation tracking and analysis
- Early trend identification and pattern recognition
- Social listening methodologies and applications
- Discussion pattern analysis across platforms

### LinkedIn Competitive Intelligence
- Competitor content performance analysis
- Engagement pattern recognition and benchmarking
- Attribution data analysis from social interactions
- Content strategy optimization approaches

### B2B Marketing Attribution
- Social media ROI measurement approaches
- Engagement tracking methodologies
- Lead attribution through social interactions
- Performance analytics across touchpoints

## Comment Approaches (Choose Most Natural)

### 1. Strategic Insight
Share a strategic observation or framework without needing stats:
*"The templated approach problem is real. Authenticity beats scale every time in B2B outreach."*

### 2. Tactical Advice
Offer practical next steps or methodology:
*"Try mentioning specific content they've shared instead of generic social proof. Way more effective."*

### 3. Pattern Recognition
Share what you've observed without claiming specific data:
*"I see this template everywhere now. The 'friend recommended' angle is becoming a red flag for prospects."*

### 4. Alternative Perspective
Offer a different angle or challenge assumptions:
*"Social proof works, but fabricated social proof backfires. Genuine connection points beat templates."*

### 5. Experience-Based Insight
Share what you've learned without quantifying:
*"Switched from templates to actual social intelligence. Mentioning their specific posts works much better."*

## Guidelines

### Voice & Tone
- **Direct and conversational**
- **No buzzwords or corporate speak**
- **Sound like practical experience**
- **Helpful without being promotional**

### Length & Structure
- **Maximum 30 words**
- **1-2 sentences maximum**
- **One clear insight or piece of advice**
- **Natural, not forced**

### When to Use Stats/Placeholders
**Use sparingly and only when:**
- The insight genuinely requires data support
- You would realistically have that specific information
- The stat adds meaningful value to the discussion
- Format: `{verify: approximate range}` only when necessary

### When NOT to Use Stats
- General observations about trends or patterns
- Tactical advice or recommendations
- Strategic insights or frameworks
- Opinion-based perspectives
- Common industry knowledge

### Value-Add Options
Instead of defaulting to "I track X," consider:
- **Tactical alternatives**: "Try X instead of Y"
- **Pattern observations**: "This approach is becoming common"
- **Strategic insights**: "The real issue is Z"
- **Experience sharing**: "I switched from A to B"
- **Perspective challenges**: "Different angle: consider X"

## Comment Examples

### Without Stats (Preferred Most Times)
*"The templated approach kills authenticity. Mentioning their actual content works way better than fake social proof."*

*"This opener is everywhere now. Prospects recognize templates instantly. Real connection points beat fabricated ones."*

*"Switched from templates to genuine research. Takes longer but response rates are night and day."*

### With Minimal Data (When Relevant)
*"Template overuse is real. {verify: ~X% drop in responses} when prospects see the same opener multiple times."*

## Quality Standards

### Comments Should:
- Add genuine value to the conversation
- Sound authentic and experience-based
- Provide actionable insight or perspective
- Be concise and impactful
- Feel natural, not forced

### Avoid:
- Always starting with "I track/monitor/analyze"
- Forcing stats into every comment
- Generic agreement without added value
- Overly formal or corporate language
- Making claims you can't support

## Output Instructions
Provide ONLY the comment text. Keep under 30 words. Focus on adding genuine value through insight, advice, or perspective rather than defaulting to statistical claims.
</artifact>
</artifacts>

parameters.content: Checking the source of the posts. I.e YouTube, Reddit, LinkedIn etc
## Set up Social Listening webhook via Trigify.io platform.

body.content:
Steal your copy from your ideal clients.

The exact words your prospects use to describe their pain - the tools they‚Äôre duct taping together, the budget pressure, the ‚Äúwe‚Äôve tried X but still can‚Äôt Y‚Äù lines.

That‚Äôs the good stuff.

And here‚Äôs what we‚Äôve learned:

No copy, whether human-written or AI generated, beats the vocabulary your market is already using.

A few things we do routinely:

Tag prospect language in meeting transcripts: If three VPs say ‚Äúgetting accurate pipeline visibility,‚Äù that phrase moves straight into subject lines and hooks.

Capture emotional shorthand. One prospect said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre duct-taping five platforms to send a single campaign.‚Äù That turned into one of our best-performing openers.

Reframe value props using your ideal client's order. Sometimes the benefits we think are top-tier are actually #3 on their list. We flipped the messaging hierarchy to match theirs and reply rates jumped.

Feed the language upstream: Cold outreach ‚Üí follow-up ‚Üí sales decks ‚Üí onboarding. The whole flywheel tightens.

Listening does something else too: it keeps us humble. Instead of guessing what should matter, we hear what actually matters, and we write to that.

If you want to improve cold email, don‚Äôt start in the inbox. Start in the call recordings.

user.name: Max Mitcham

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
